page.title: 02LLANSANNAN.
page.content: The village is situated in a mountain basin formed by the River Aled between the rolling hills of Hiraethog and the coastal resort of Colwyn Bay.Its unpretentious church was dedicated to St.Sannan,a sixth century celtic saint.Two of the three local chapels commemorate the famous brothers Gwilym Hiraethog,a Welsh preacher,poet and man of letters,born in 1802,and Henry Rees,preacher,born in 1798.The bronze figure of a little Welsh maiden wearing a garland of immortelles located in the centre of the village was designed as a memorial to all the distinguished sons of the parish.They are represented on the statue by the above brothers,by William Salesbury,first translator of the New Testament into Welsh,by Tudur Aled,poet and by Iorwerth Glan Aled.
